jobs.subject: Electromagnetic Field 2022: Villages, Call for Volunteers and Bring & Donate
jobs.text_body:
Hello! EMF is rapidly approaching, so we’ll be contacting you every few weeks with information about what to expect and things you should know. Today we’re announcing village registration & furniture booking, asking for help, begging for giant robots, and getting you digging through your junk piles! Villages === Camping at EMF is often organised into [villages](https://www.emfcamp.org/villages/2022) - groups of attendees camping together who share interests or know one another. Everyone is encouraged to join or create villages but it’s not mandatory, don’t panic! We are now allowing villages to [register](https://www.emfcamp.org/villages/register) so our team can ensure you have enough space on-site, as well as allowing you to [book a marquee and furniture](https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/hire) which will be set up and ready for when you arrive on site. If you need an introduction to villages, [see our guide](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/villages). Volunteers === EMF is entirely organised & run by unpaid volunteers, and we're looking for people to join our team. At the moment we are recruiting for pre-event volunteers to assist with work in the run-up to the event. No experience is necessary for most roles, but an interest in the area helps! **The following teams currently need pre-event volunteers:** * **[Design](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles#design)** - Visual and physical assets across the festival * **[Badge](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles#badge)** - Electronics and software design for our unique camp badge * **[Content](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles#content)** - Organising, outreach and support for talks, workshops & music * **[Logistics](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles#logistics)** - Ensuring things get where they need to be at the right time * **[Null Sector / Cybar](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles#cybar)** - The night-time bar, music venue, and arts space * **[Art & Installations](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles#arts)** - Organising installations and amazing artworks around the site * **[Volunteering](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles#volunteer)** - Managing volunteers, shift sign-up, scheduling, and rewards * **[Tent Team](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles#tent)** - Helping people new to the event get set up You can see a full list of roles and details of each team [on our website](https://emfcamp.org/about/volunteer-roles). To express interest please send an email to [volunteers@emfcamp.org](mailto:volunteers@emfcamp.org) introducing yourself, specifying the role you’re interested in, and any experience you might have. If you can't find a role that interests you but would still like to help pre-event, get in touch - we'll do our best to find something that fits! If you’d rather help during the event, you’ll be able to sign up for shifts via the website closer to the time. Installations === We're looking for installations to entertain people across the site - things to play with, things to admire, and things to be puzzled by. Giant robots, weird instruments, captivating lights, strange games, and curious structures. We're especially looking for installations that might be suitable for our "Null Sector" night-time area. This year the theme is "2022 Leagues Under the Sea" - Jules Verne gone cyberpunk. If you'd like to submit an installation (or already have something suitable), please email [installations@emfcamp.org](mailto:installations@emfcamp.org) Bring & Donate === We know your home/shed/workshop is bursting at the seams with unwanted gadgets, half-finished robots, unusual tools, and crates of eclectic ephemera. We’d like to help you rehome them, all while raising money for the Red Cross. Simply leave your baffling boxes of things at the Bring & Donate stall and after the event you’ll receive an email letting you know how much your items raised. But don’t forget to make a donation and take some curious items home with you! Full details and guidance can be found [on our website](https://emfcamp.org/about/bring-and-donate). News === If you’d like to more frequent updates about EMF, follow us on Twitter: [@emfcamp](https://twitter.com/emfcamp). Sponsors === Your ticket price pays for us to run the event, but we rely on sponsors to help us make the event fun, accessible, and beautiful. This year we’d particularly like to thank Google Open Source for sponsoring childcare, Lucid for sponsoring transcription, Sargasso Networks, SOS Intelligence, Onega, and iluli by Mike Lamb.
Looking forward to seeing you in the field! Love, The EMF Team
jobs.html_body:
Hello!

EMF is rapidly approaching, so we’ll be contacting you every few weeks with information about what to expect and things you should know.

Today we’re announcing village registration & furniture booking, asking for help, begging for giant robots, and getting you digging through your junk piles!

Villages

Camping at EMF is often organised into villages - groups of attendees camping together who share interests or know one another. Everyone is encouraged to join or create villages but it’s not mandatory, don’t panic!

We are now allowing villages to register so our team can ensure you have enough space on-site, as well as allowing you to book a marquee and furniture which will be set up and ready for when you arrive on site.

If you need an introduction to villages, see our guide.

Volunteers

EMF is entirely organised & run by unpaid volunteers, and we’re looking for people to join our team.

At the moment we are recruiting for pre-event volunteers to assist with work in the run-up to the event. No experience is necessary for most roles, but an interest in the area helps!

The following teams currently need pre-event volunteers:

  • Design - Visual and physical assets across the festival
  • Badge - Electronics and software design for our unique camp badge
  • Content - Organising, outreach and support for talks, workshops & music
  • Logistics - Ensuring things get where they need to be at the right time
  • Null Sector / Cybar - The night-time bar, music venue, and arts space
  • Art & Installations - Organising installations and amazing artworks around the site
  • Volunteering - Managing volunteers, shift sign-up, scheduling, and rewards
  • Tent Team - Helping people new to the event get set up

You can see a full list of roles and details of each team on our website. To express interest please send an email to volunteers@emfcamp.org introducing yourself, specifying the role you’re interested in, and any experience you might have.

If you can’t find a role that interests you but would still like to help pre-event, get in touch - we’ll do our best to find something that fits!

If you’d rather help during the event, you’ll be able to sign up for shifts via the website closer to the time.

Installations

We’re looking for installations to entertain people across the site - things to play with, things to admire, and things to be puzzled by. Giant robots, weird instruments, captivating lights, strange games, and curious structures.

We’re especially looking for installations that might be suitable for our “Null Sector” night-time area. This year the theme is “2022 Leagues Under the Sea” - Jules Verne gone cyberpunk.

If you’d like to submit an installation (or already have something suitable), please email installations@emfcamp.org

Bring & Donate

We know your home/shed/workshop is bursting at the seams with unwanted gadgets, half-finished robots, unusual tools, and crates of eclectic ephemera. We’d like to help you rehome them, all while raising money for the Red Cross.

Simply leave your baffling boxes of things at the Bring & Donate stall and after the event you’ll receive an email letting you know how much your items raised. But don’t forget to make a donation and take some curious items home with you!

Full details and guidance can be found on our website.

News

If you’d like to more frequent updates about EMF, follow us on Twitter: @emfcamp.

Sponsors

Your ticket price pays for us to run the event, but we rely on sponsors to help us make the event fun, accessible, and beautiful. This year we’d particularly like to thank Google Open Source for sponsoring childcare, Lucid for sponsoring transcription, Sargasso Networks, SOS Intelligence, Onega, and iluli by Mike Lamb.


Looking forward to seeing you in the field!

Love,
The EMF Team

You're receiving this email because you have a ticket for Electromagnetic Field 2022.

Sent by EMF Festivals Ltd, 483 Green Lanes, London, N13 4BS.

jobs.subject: Electromagnetic Field is one month away!
jobs.text_body:
Hello! EMF is one month away, so we're going to be in touch each week with exciting news and announcements. Tickets are still available -- **We still have a [small number of EMF tickets left!](https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets)** If you know people who might like to come, please let them know. Call for talks, workshops, and installations -- Our [Call for Participation (CfP)](https://www.emfcamp.org/cfp) is still open! **We are especially looking for workshops & activities suitable for our smaller attendees under the age of 6**, but talks, workshops and performances suitable for all ages are still welcome. We've now announced the [first set of talks](https://www.emfcamp.org/schedule/2022) - please favourite the talks you're most interested in so our scheduling robot can pick the optimal time for them. If you're planning on bringing an installation that's big, potentially unsafe, has specific requirements from us, or that you'd like to put in a public area, please submit it via the CfP. Otherwise let us know at [installations@emfcamp.org](mailto:installations@emfcamp.org) (We love to know what you're bringing along!) Night Market -- Null Sector will yet again be running a cyberpunk street market for makers. **If you'd like to sell your things, please [sign up for a stall](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfFQTN_Mni9nxckr7ZR_H92Zv88ZYwpnic_CAgHLBa39Gpbsg/viewform)** - it's free! You can either sell products in person, or you can show off what you do. Volunteer -- We had a fantastic response to the previous call for volunteers - thank you to everyone who's pitched in. EMF is entirely organised & run by unpaid volunteers and we need all the help we can get. **At the moment we're particularly looking to fill the following roles:** * **First aid** - We need people with First Aid at Work (or better) qualifications to join the First Aid team. Anyone volunteering for at least three eight-hour shifts can have the cost of their ticket refunded. * **Sewists** - The design team need help stitching together bunting, flags, and signage. If you have a sewing machine and a few hours ahead of EMF, please get in touch. * **Build-up carpenter** - We're looking for someone to be in charge of organising and building various pieces of wooden site infrastructure. You'll need to be on site early (at least from Saturday 28th May). * **Logistics assistant** - The logistics team needs help both for set up, tracking items into the site, and moving things around site during the event. * **Set loading in London** - Null Sector is looking for help to load a truck on the 25th May, 9am, in Battersea. We have a lot of exciting set pieces to get to the field this year, and appreciate any helping hand we can find for the final push. To help with any of these roles please email [volunteer@emfcamp.org](mailto:volunteer@emfcamp.org) and say hello. Sponsors -- Your ticket price pays for us to run the event, but we rely on sponsors to help us make the event fun, accessible, and beautiful. This year we’d particularly like to thank **[Google Open Source](https://opensource.google/)** for sponsoring childcare, **[Lucid](https://luc.id)** for sponsoring talk transcription, **[Twilio](https://twilio.com)** for sponsoring the arcade, **[Sargasso Networks](http://www.sargasso.co.uk)**, **[SOS Intelligence](https://sosintel.co.uk)**, **[PCBGoGo](https://www.pcbgogo.com/)**, **[Mathworks](https://www.mathworks.com/)**, **[iluli by Mike Lamb](https://www.iluli.eu)**, **[Onega](https://onega.net)** and **[UCL Connected Environments](https://connected-environments.org/)** for their support. We're still looking for sponsors. If your company is interested in helping support EMF please drop us a line at [sponsors@emfcamp.org](mailto:sponsors@emfcamp.org).
See you in the field! Love, The EMF Team
jobs.html_body:
Hello!

EMF is one month away, so we’re going to be in touch each week with exciting news and announcements.

Tickets are still available

We still have a small number of EMF tickets left! If you know people who might like to come, please let them know.

Call for talks, workshops, and installations

Our Call for Participation (CfP) is still open!

We are especially looking for workshops & activities suitable for our smaller attendees under the age of 6, but talks, workshops and performances suitable for all ages are still welcome.

We’ve now announced the first set of talks - please favourite the talks you’re most interested in so our scheduling robot can pick the optimal time for them.

If you’re planning on bringing an installation that’s big, potentially unsafe, has specific requirements from us, or that you’d like to put in a public area, please submit it via the CfP. Otherwise let us know at installations@emfcamp.org (We love to know what you’re bringing along!)

Night Market

Null Sector will yet again be running a cyberpunk street market for makers. If you’d like to sell your things, please sign up for a stall - it’s free! You can either sell products in person, or you can show off what you do.

Volunteer

We had a fantastic response to the previous call for volunteers - thank you to everyone who’s pitched in. EMF is entirely organised & run by unpaid volunteers and we need all the help we can get.

At the moment we’re particularly looking to fill the following roles:

  • First aid - We need people with First Aid at Work (or better) qualifications to join the First Aid team. Anyone volunteering for at least three eight-hour shifts can have the cost of their ticket refunded.
  • Sewists - The design team need help stitching together bunting, flags, and signage. If you have a sewing machine and a few hours ahead of EMF, please get in touch.
  • Build-up carpenter - We’re looking for someone to be in charge of organising and building various pieces of wooden site infrastructure. You’ll need to be on site early (at least from Saturday 28th May).
  • Logistics assistant - The logistics team needs help both for set up, tracking items into the site, and moving things around site during the event.
  • Set loading in London - Null Sector is looking for help to load a truck on the 25th May, 9am, in Battersea. We have a lot of exciting set pieces to get to the field this year, and appreciate any helping hand we can find for the final push.

To help with any of these roles please email volunteer@emfcamp.org and say hello.

Sponsors

Your ticket price pays for us to run the event, but we rely on sponsors to help us make the event fun, accessible, and beautiful.

This year we’d particularly like to thank Google Open Source for sponsoring childcare, Lucid for sponsoring talk transcription, Twilio for sponsoring the arcade, Sargasso Networks, SOS Intelligence, PCBGoGo, Mathworks, iluli by Mike Lamb, Onega and UCL Connected Environments for their support.

We’re still looking for sponsors. If your company is interested in helping support EMF please drop us a line at sponsors@emfcamp.org.

See you in the field!

Love,
The EMF Team

jobs.subject: Electromagnetic Field is two weeks away!
jobs.text_body:
Hello,

We are now two weeks away from EMF, so it's time for another update!

Today we're talking about volunteering, phones, tickets, covid, getting to site, and scanning electron microscopes.

First Aid volunteers
---

We're urgently looking for First Aiders to take shifts throughout the event. If you, or someone you know, holds a FREC3 (or better) qualification we'd love to hear from you at [firstaid@emfcamp.org](mailto:firstaid@emfcamp.org). We can offer day tickets for those qualifying, or if you do 3 shifts of 8h, we'll reimburse your weekend ticket - we can also help with travel expenses if needed.

Phones
--
Mobile phone coverage on site is extremely bad, so we have our own on-site phone network!

Our DECT network uses cheap household cordless telephones - if you bring a [compatible handset](https://eventphone.de/doku/dect_phone_compatibility_list) then you can [register your preferred phone number](https://guru3.eventphone.de/). This will let you phone other users and the variety of phone-based services on site.

**Warning:** the Gigaset A170 (which is pretty common) has had problems connecting to the Eventphone system. 

We will shortly be opening up access to our phone developer portal that allows you to build applications running on our site-wide phone network, so you can dial 555-FIRE-LASERS.

We also have a full copper phone network supporting voice calls, dial-up, and fax. Bring your old modem along and pretend its 1998! More details on how to connect will be available next week.

Call for Participation
--

Our [Call for Participation](https://emfcamp.org/cfp) will be closing on Friday (May 20th) evening, if you've not yet sent us your ideas for a Talk, Workshop or Performance you must do so now.

If you cannot submit before this deadline, please let us know by emailing [content@emfcamp.org](mailto:content@emfcamp.org), and please email [installations@emfcamp.org](mailto:installations@emfcamp.org) if you're bringing an amazing installation!

Ticket transfer
--

If you bought tickets for other people, please [transfer them over on the website](https://www.emfcamp.org/account/purchases) - this means they'll get update emails from us, and ensure that if they arrive separately from you they'll be able to check in on arrival.

COVID
--

COVID is still a very real risk, regardless of your health status. We want EMF to be a safe and welcoming event, and to aid that we have a few requests:

* Please ensure you're up-to-date on your COVID vaccinations
* Take a rapid test (lateral flow test/LFT) the day you leave for EMF
* If possible, bring rapid tests with you to take during the event
* Bring masks, and wear a mask if you're in a busy enclosed area

Full details of our [policy are on the website](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/health). Tests can be bought from retailers e.g. Boots or Superdrug for about £1-£2 each, or online for less.

Other things to be aware of
--
* The [site opens](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/arrival-times) on Thursday 2nd at 10am so you can set up, but talks won't start until Friday morning. Food vendors and the bar will be open on Thursday, and some villages will be running workshops.
* The site closes on Monday 6th at 12 noon. On Sunday talks run into the evening and music until midnight
* Thursday 2nd and Friday 3rd are bank holidays so public transport will be running reduced timetables and some shops will be closed or operating shorter hours
* If you're driving to site you must have a [parking ticket](https://emfcamp.org/tickets), however if you have a campervan ticket you don't need a separate parking ticket
* We won’t be offering electric car charging on site. We have more details and suggested charge locations on [our travel page](https://emfcamp.org/about/travel#electric-cars)
* Please bring things to look at under the scanning electron microscope, but decap your chips at home!

Sponsors
--

Your ticket price pays for us to run the event, but we rely on sponsors to help us make the event fun, accessible, and beautiful.

This year we’d particularly like to thank **[Google Open Source](https://opensource.google/)** for sponsoring childcare, **[Lucid](https://luc.id)** for sponsoring talk transcription, **[Sargasso Networks](http://www.sargasso.co.uk)**, **[SOS Intelligence](https://sosintel.co.uk)**, **[PCBGoGo](https://www.pcbgogo.com/)**, **[Mathworks](https://www.mathworks.com/)**, **[iluli by Mike Lamb](https://www.iluli.eu)**, **[Onega](https://onega.net)**, **[ARDC](https://www.ampr.org/)** and **[UCL Connected Environments](https://connected-environments.org/)** for their support.

We're always looking for more sponsors. If your company is interested in helping support EMF please take a look at at [our sponsor packages](https://www.emfcamp.org/sponsor) and drop us a line on [sponsors@emfcamp.org](mailto:sponsors@emfcamp.org).


Looking forward to seeing you in the field.

Love,
The EMF Team

We are now two weeks away from EMF, so it’s time for another update!

Today we’re talking about volunteering, phones, tickets, covid, getting to site, and scanning electron microscopes.

jobs.subject: Electromagnetic Field is one week away!
jobs.text_body:
Hello!

We're one week away and the team are on site putting up tents and laying cable, ready for you all to join us.

In this email we'll be talking about the schedule, lightning talks, volunteering, badges, phones, APIs, what to bring, and the tent team.

Schedule
--

Our main Call for Participation is now closed. The scheduling robot has been carefully shuffling content over the last week, and we now have a [talk schedule](https://www.emfcamp.org/schedule/2022)!

This is subject to change, but we recommend you give it a look over and favourite things you want to see. **Timings for workshops, music, performances, and films will be announced on Monday.**

While we don't have room for any more full talks, lighting talk sign up is now open - you'll find more details below. We also still want to hear about the installations you're bringing! Get in touch on [installations@emfcamp.org](mailto:installations@emfcamp.org).

Lightning Talks
--

We have lightning talk sessions each day - short 5 minute talks on any topic running back-to-back. Got One Weird Trick you want to share, or an amazing project pitch? Put together some slides, [fill in the form](https://www.emfcamp.org/cfp/lightning) and prepare to talk quickly!

Volunteering
--

You'll be able to sign up for volunteering shifts via the website in the next few days. As always, **anyone wanting to help with build up and/or tear down should get in touch beforehand** to confirm that we need help. Please do not arrive on site before Thursday 2nd June without prior agreement.

During the event those who complete a volunteering shift will get a free meal at our excellent volunteer kitchen. This year, to help reduce waste (and volunteers having to spend hours washing up) **please bring your own crockery and cutlery**.

As well as volunteer shifts during the event, we still need core volunteers for:

* First Aid team, with at least FREC3 certification. Please contact [firstaid@emfcamp.org](mailto:firstaid@emfcamp.org)
* Conduct & Accessibility team, to assist with accessibility needs on site, or matters relating to the code of conduct. Please contact [conduct@emfcamp.org](mailto:conduct@emfcamp.org)


Badges
--

This year's electronic badges use a USB-C plug that can be inserted directly into laptops with a USB-C port. If you want to charge and hack on it during the event and your computer doesn't have USB-C ports you'll need to bring an adaptor - you can get one from [here](https://www.euroffice.co.uk/product/connekt-gear-usb-3-adapter-a-male-to-type-c-female-otg-black-26-0420/agl437), [there](https://www.kenable.co.uk/en/usb-cables-adapters/usb-type-c-cables/usb-c-adapters/11428-usb-3-a-male-to-usb-31-type-c-socket-sync-or-charge-converter-adapter-5gbps-5054338114286.html), or [this place](https://www.amazon.co.uk/Adapter-Charger-Connector-Mini-Led-Generation-Black/dp/B07Z662186)!

The on-site shop will also have a limited number of adapters for sale.

Phones
--

As mentioned in our last email we have our own phone network on-site, and have now [published our developer documentation](https://developer.emfcamp.org/phones) so you can build applications for attendees to interact with through the phone system! We can't wait to see what you do with it.

We also support important phone services such as dial-up, fax, ISDN, ADSL, and bulletin boards. If you'd like to bring along your modem and fax machine the [CuTEL wiki page has the details](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Village:CuTEL_HQ).

Our DECT network uses cheap household cordless telephones - if you bring a [compatible handset](https://eventphone.de/doku/dect_phone_compatibility_list) then you can register your [preferred phone number](https://guru3.eventphone.de/). This will let you phone other users and the variety of phone-based services on site. 

Developers / APIs
--

We love opening up our data for attendees to play with and we'd love you to do the same.

Our [developer documentation](https://developer.emfcamp.org/) is now live and being added to daily - you can fetch the schedule, check how much internet we're using, make phone calls, find out which beers the bar is serving, and much more.

If you're building something for EMF that exposes an API, please add it to the documentation so others can experiment with it!

What to bring
--

If you've not been to EMF before and are a little unsure what you'll need have a look at our [guide](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/what-to-bring), while you still have time to buy things!

Lift & Equipment Sharing
--

If you're still not sure how you're getting to EMF, or if you've got a spare seat or two in your car, take a look at the [lift sharing page on the wiki](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Location/Lift_sharing). Sharing a journey helps other attendees, and reduces the carbon footprint of the event. There's also a [similar page for camping equipment](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Camping_Gear_Lending_and_Borrowing).

Tent Team
--

Talking of camping equipment: new this year is the Tent Team! They'll be on site from Thursday afternoon to help with any problems you might have putting up your tent and getting settled in. Phone 1020 (TENt-20) via DECT, or go to the Info tent to get in contact with them.

Sponsors
--

Your ticket price pays for us to run the event, but we rely on sponsors to help us make the event fun, accessible, and beautiful.

This year we’d particularly like to thank **[Google Open Source](https://opensource.google/)** for sponsoring childcare, **[Lucid](https://luc.id)** for sponsoring talk transcription, **[Twilio](https://www.twilio.com/)** for sponsoring the arcade, **[PCBGoGo](https://www.pcbgogo.com/)** for badge assembly, **[Sargasso Networks](http://www.sargasso.co.uk)**, **[SOS Intelligence](https://sosintel.co.uk)**, **[Mathworks](https://www.mathworks.com/)**, **[iluli by Mike Lamb](https://www.iluli.eu)**, **[Onega](https://onega.net)**, **[ARDC](https://www.ampr.org/)**, **[Aiven](https://aiven.io/)**, **[Huboo](https://www.huboo.com)**, and **[UCL Connected Environments](https://connected-environments.org/)** for their support.

We're always looking for more sponsors. If your company is interested in helping support EMF please take a look at at [our sponsor packages](https://www.emfcamp.org/sponsor) and drop us a line on [sponsors@emfcamp.org](mailto:sponsors@emfcamp.org).


Looking forward to seeing you in the field.

Love,
The EMF Team
jobs.html_body:
Hello!

We’re one week away and the team are on site putting up tents and laying cable, ready for you all to join us.

In this email we’ll be talking about the schedule, lightning talks, volunteering, badges, phones, APIs, what to bring, and the tent team.

Schedule

Our main Call for Participation is now closed. The scheduling robot has been carefully shuffling content over the last week, and we now have a talk schedule!

This is subject to change, but we recommend you give it a look over and favourite things you want to see. Timings for workshops, music, performances, and films will be announced on Monday.

While we don’t have room for any more full talks, lighting talk sign up is now open - you’ll find more details below. We also still want to hear about the installations you’re bringing! Get in touch on installations@emfcamp.org.

Lightning Talks

We have lightning talk sessions each day - short 5 minute talks on any topic running back-to-back. Got One Weird Trick you want to share, or an amazing project pitch? Put together some slides, fill in the form and prepare to talk quickly!

Volunteering

You’ll be able to sign up for volunteering shifts via the website in the next few days. As always, anyone wanting to help with build up and/or tear down should get in touch beforehand to confirm that we need help. Please do not arrive on site before Thursday 2nd June without prior agreement.

During the event those who complete a volunteering shift will get a free meal at our excellent volunteer kitchen. This year, to help reduce waste (and volunteers having to spend hours washing up) please bring your own crockery and cutlery.

As well as volunteer shifts during the event, we still need core volunteers for:

  • First Aid team, with at least FREC3 certification. Please contact firstaid@emfcamp.org
  • Conduct & Accessibility team, to assist with accessibility needs on site, or matters relating to the code of conduct. Please contact conduct@emfcamp.org

Badges

This year’s electronic badges use a USB-C plug that can be inserted directly into laptops with a USB-C port. If you want to charge and hack on it during the event and your computer doesn’t have USB-C ports you’ll need to bring an adaptor - you can get one from here, there, or this place!

The on-site shop will also have a limited number of adapters for sale.

Phones

As mentioned in our last email we have our own phone network on-site, and have now published our developer documentation so you can build applications for attendees to interact with through the phone system! We can’t wait to see what you do with it.

We also support important phone services such as dial-up, fax, ISDN, ADSL, and bulletin boards. If you’d like to bring along your modem and fax machine the CuTEL wiki page has the details.

Our DECT network uses cheap household cordless telephones - if you bring a compatible handset then you can register your preferred phone number. This will let you phone other users and the variety of phone-based services on site.

Developers / APIs

We love opening up our data for attendees to play with and we’d love you to do the same.

Our developer documentation is now live and being added to daily - you can fetch the schedule, check how much internet we’re using, make phone calls, find out which beers the bar is serving, and much more.

If you’re building something for EMF that exposes an API, please add it to the documentation so others can experiment with it!

What to bring

If you’ve not been to EMF before and are a little unsure what you’ll need have a look at our guide, while you still have time to buy things!

Lift & Equipment Sharing

If you’re still not sure how you’re getting to EMF, or if you’ve got a spare seat or two in your car, take a look at the lift sharing page on the wiki. Sharing a journey helps other attendees, and reduces the carbon footprint of the event. There’s also a similar page for camping equipment.

Tent Team

Talking of camping equipment: new this year is the Tent Team! They’ll be on site from Thursday afternoon to help with any problems you might have putting up your tent and getting settled in. Phone 1020 (TENt-20) via DECT, or go to the Info tent to get in contact with them.

Sponsors

Your ticket price pays for us to run the event, but we rely on sponsors to help us make the event fun, accessible, and beautiful.

This year we’d particularly like to thank Google Open Source for sponsoring childcare, Lucid for sponsoring talk transcription, Twilio for sponsoring the arcade, PCBGoGo for badge assembly, Sargasso Networks, SOS Intelligence, Mathworks, iluli by Mike Lamb, Onega, ARDC, Aiven, Huboo, and UCL Connected Environments for their support.

We’re always looking for more sponsors. If your company is interested in helping support EMF please take a look at at our sponsor packages and drop us a line on sponsors@emfcamp.org.

Looking forward to seeing you in the field.

Love,
The EMF Team

You're receiving this email because you have a ticket for Electromagnetic Field 2022.

jobs.subject: Villages @ emfcamp
jobs.text_body:
Hi there,

We're at a point where you're able to schedule things on our main schedule as a village! 

Head to https://www.emfcamp.org/ and find "My Account" at the bottom. 

You should see a block labelled "Your Content", through which you can add events at your village, in the lounge or main bar.

This is a great way to get like minded people to come and find your village or get together in a central location!

We're still working on getting points on a map, this might end up being a map that reflects reality instead of a map that books spaces. 

For those of you showing up on Wednesday, I look forward to seeing you tomorrow! I'll be contactable all day on radio and DECT (4422/HIBB). Have a look in advance at https://map.emfcamp.org and see where you'd like to camp, we'll be happy to direct you. 

For the villages who've rented marquees, I'll be in contact shortly with more information on where you've been placed - the tent vendor is still on site putting the last of them up!

Any issues, shoot an email to villages@ and I'll be manning it when I'm sat down today, tomorrow and onwards!

Love,
Hibby & The Village People <3

jobs.subject: Electromagnetic Field is this week!
jobs.text_body:
Hello,

Greetings from a portacabin in (mostly) sunny Herefordshire!

The tents are up, the generators are running and Electromagnetic Field is almost upon us. We're very excited to welcome you all back for more talks, workshops, music, and lasers.

In this final email we want to talk about getting here, the weather, volunteering, talks & workshops, our Code of Conduct, photography, and some other things you may want to know about.

Getting in 📍
--

You can arrive any time from 10am on Thursday 2nd, and leave as late as noon on Monday the 6th. Food vendors and the bar will be open on Thursday. Official content starts on Friday at 10am and **runs until late Sunday night**. General timings can be found [on the website](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/arrival-times), and [in the schedule](https://emfcamp.org/schedule).

We have more details on [getting to the field](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/travel), and about navigating the field [on our map](https://map.emfcamp.org).

Please remember that it is a bank holiday weekend and public transport may be affected.

Reminder: **We do not allow dogs on site other than service animals**.

It is ❄️ cold ❄️ at night
--

The [forecast](https://www.metoffice.gov.uk/weather/forecast/gcq20bkjn#?nearestTo=Eastnor%20(Herefordshire)&date=2022-05-31) predicts night temperatures below 10ºC. This is quite cold - please make sure you have adequate tents, clothing, and sleeping bags.

If you find yourself struggling please contact the first aid team.

Volunteer signup 
--

[Volunteer registration](https://www.emfcamp.org/volunteer) is live! Some shifts require training and/or being over 18 (e.g. bar shifts).

Electromagnetic Field is run and organised entirely by unpaid volunteers. Every hour you volunteer makes the festival better for everyone - and you get a delicious meal in the volunteer lounge!

Talks, workshops, music & installations
--

The full schedule of talks, workshops, performances, and music on the main stages [is now published](https://www.emfcamp.org/schedule/2022). Timings are subject to change, and content being run by [villages](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/villages) will be revealed over the coming days. Installations are scattered throughout the site - seek them out!

We're still looking for Null Sector DJs. If you fancy playing a set please email [music@emfcamp.org](mailto:music@emfcamp.org).

Publish Your Events 🗓
--

If you're running a meetup, workshop, or anything else you can now publish it in the [official schedule](https://emfcamp.org/schedule).

Villages can publish events in their areas, but anybody can announce gatherings in the bar or lounge. Login to [your account](https://www.emfcamp.org/account) and look for the box labelled "Your Content".

Code of Conduct
--

Everyone at EMF is required to abide by our Code of Conduct, both at the event and in any online channels. 

In short:

* Do not engage in homophobic, biphobic, racist, transphobic, ableist, sexist or otherwise prejudiced behaviour.
* Do not harass people. Unconsented physical contact or sexual attention is harassment. Dressing or acting in a certain way is not consent.
* Aggression and elitism are not welcome. Nobody should be afraid to ask questions.

You can see the full [Code of Conduct](https://emfcamp.org/code-of-conduct), along with our target response times, and details on the penalties for violations.

If you experience any of this behaviour or witness a breach of our code of conduct, please contact a volunteer or the support team, send us an email at [conduct@emfcamp.org](mailto:conduct@emfcamp.org), or call Internal **1012** or **+44 1908 870 912**. During EMF, calls or face-to-face meetings are preferred.

Where possible, please let us know about your concerns as quickly as possible so we can take appropriate action.

Photography 📷
--

We love to see how you experience EMF through photos, videos and other records. Please [share them with us](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Mrv2ULYd71BkqFkpz3qjJMrlyBJRmSs1ypb4LwL0eKM).

We also have a list of things we'd love to see photographs of on our [wiki](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Photography).

Quick Bits 
--

* [Hebocon](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Hebocon), the terrible robot fight is back. [Build your terrible robot](https://www.emfcamp.org/schedule/2022/354-hebocon-robot-building-workshop), and on Saturday night we pit them against one another!
* We have a scanning electron microscope in Null Sector. Please bring things to scan in it.
* If you have gizmos you no longer want, drop them off at our [bring and donate stand](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/bring-and-donate) next to the shop, and take away something you never knew you needed!
* The EMF 2022 badge plugs directly into a USB-C port, so unless you have a device with a USB-C port you'll need an adaptor.

COVID
--

COVID is still a very real risk, regardless of your health status. We want EMF to be safe and COVID-free. We ask that you:

* Ensure that your COVID vaccinations are up-to-date
* Take a rapid test (lateral flow test) the day you leave for EMF
* Bring rapid tests with you to take during the event
* Bring masks and wear a mask if you're in a busy enclosed area

Full details of our [policy are on our website](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/health)

Sponsors
--

Your ticket price pays for us to run the event, but we rely on sponsors to help us make the event fun, accessible, and beautiful.

This year we’d particularly like to thank **[Google Open Source](https://opensource.google/)** for sponsoring childcare, **[Lucid](https://luc.id)** for sponsoring talk transcription, **[Twilio](https://www.twilio.com/)** for sponsoring the arcade, **[Espressif](https://www.espressif.com)** for badge components, **[PCBGoGo](https://www.pcbgogo.com/)** for badge assembly, **[Aiven](https://aiven.io/)**, **[ARDC](https://www.ampr.org/)**, **[Mathworks](https://www.mathworks.com/)**, **[Mullvad](https://mullvad.net)**, **[Sargasso Networks](http://www.sargasso.co.uk)**, **[SOS Intelligence](https://sosintel.co.uk)**, **[Huboo](https://www.huboo.com)**, **[iluli by Mike Lamb](https://www.iluli.eu)**, **[Onega](https://onega.net)**,  and **[UCL Connected Environments](https://connected-environments.org/)** for their support.

We're always looking for more sponsors. If your company is interested in helping support EMF please take a look at at [our sponsor packages](https://www.emfcamp.org/sponsor) and drop us a line on [sponsors@emfcamp.org](mailto:sponsors@emfcamp.org).

Looking forward to seeing you in the field.

Love,
The EMF Team

jobs.subject: Wind and gazebos
jobs.text_body:
Hi

According to various weather forecasts there is a risk of relatively high gusts of winds this evening. Please check any structures you have (particularly light ones like gazebos) are secured (ideally guyed).

Cheers,

EMF team
